boat.name: Our Daddy
boat.full_description:
Our Daddy was built for AJ Pengelly of Looe as the last sailing fishing boat built from a Looe yard by Dick Pearce. She fished until the mid 1970s and then became a shark fishing day boat skippered by Terry Pengelly.

In 1988 she was refitted as a yacht by Mike Dickinson and Mike Cotton and operated as a charter boat from Looe until approximately 2011.

She came to Brixham under new ownership to be used as a charter boat but fell into disrepair, and then bought by Steve Styles and Tim Sunderland in 2013.

2015 finds her in refit at Brixham and will again be working as a charted boat in the South West of England.
boat.construction_details: Larch on Oak frames. Carvel planked, tight seamed.
boat.short_description: Our Daddy is a fishing lugger, built for AJ Pengelly of Looe. She was the last sailing fishing boat from a Looe yard. She ihas a gaff rigged main and lug sail on the mizzen mast.
